incidents.name: Network Congestion towards origins in Eastern North America

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare experienced a network congestion in Eastern North America, causing degraded origin connectivity from our global network to origins in Eastern North America.

The impact occurred between 08:05 UTC and 09:36 UTC. The issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: Egress broken for dedicated egress IPv6

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Egress broken for dedicated egress IPv6. Customers using dedicated egress (Aegis or Zero Trust) on IPv6 are affected and may be experiencing 520 errors. The engineering team has identified the issue and is working on releasing a fix.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Stream: longer time-to-ready for uploads

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare's R2 service is experiencing elevated write latency in the WNAM region. Impacted users will see increased response times on put operations. Stream users may experience longer than usual times for new uploaded videos to be ready to play. Images hosted assets are experiencing higher than usual latency and increased API error responses. Images Transformations, Media Transformations, and Live Broadcasts are unaffected.

Cloudflare Stream is currently observing longer than usual times for new uploaded videos to be ready to play. Live Streaming, Playback and WebRTC are unaffected.
We are working to analyze and mitigate this problem.

incidents.name: Missing Cloudflare Access Login Events

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.
Log recovery is completed. All logs should be recovered in the dashboard. Duplicates are most likely to occur at the beginning and end of the incident impact window.

Cloudflare Engineering identified a path to recover the Access logs lost during the impact window. Recovering these logs could result in a handful of duplicate login events. These logs should show up with identical timestamps and request IDs; the duplicates can be disregarded.

Cloudflare engineering identified an issue that caused Access Login events to fail from 2025-10-02 17:40 UTC until 2025-10-02 18:33 UTC (there could be observed impact slightly before or after). All login events during this period would not have been logged via Access Request logs. Logs sent via Logpush were not impacted.

Access authentication and other services were not impacted during this window.

Cloudflare engineering is working on recovering these logs and will post updates during this investigation.

incidents.name: Brand Protection Errors

incident_updates.body: On 2025-09-30, a spike in traffic to the Brand Protection API triggered a gradual degradation in the performance of this system. The system went fully offline at 2025-10-02 14:48 UTC. We implemented a fix to resolve this issue at 2025-10-02 16:40 UTC, after which Brand Protection returned to a healthy state.

incidents.name: Email Security Investigations are not working on the Dashboard and API

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

An issue with search database is preventing retrieval of mail processing records for both detections and benign messages since 00:00Z 01 Oct. The Email Security service is not impacted by this. All messages are being processed and delivered as expected.

incidents.name: WARP connectivity

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare WARP+ and WireGuard. Cloudflare WARP+ users connecting using WireGuard protocol are impacted. WARP+ users can connect using MASQUE protocol as a workaround. WARP and Cloudflare Zero Trust services are not impacted.

components.name: Realtime SFU
components.description: Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

components.name: Realtime TURN Service
components.description:
Separately from the SFU, Realtime offers a managed TURN service. TURN acts as a relay point for traffic between WebRTC clients like the browser and SFUs, particularly in scenarios where direct communication is obstructed by NATs or firewalls. TURN maintains an allocation of public IP addresses and ports for each session, ensuring connectivity even in restrictive network environments.

Using Cloudflare Realtime TURN service is available free of charge when used together with the Realtime SFU. Otherwise, it costs $0.05/real-time GB outbound from Cloudflare to the TURN client.

components.name: RealtimeKit
components.description:
Build real-time serverless video, audio and data applications.

Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

components.description: Cloudflare Stream lets you or your end users upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API, without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

incidents.name: Elevated Errors for R2 and Stream Uploads

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Stream impact resolved as of 17:25 UTC.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with R2 and uploading videos to Stream. 

We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem.  More updates to follow shortly.

components.name: Stream
components.description: Cloudflare Stream lets you or your end users upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API, without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

incidents.name: Increased HTTP 5xx Errors

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare was investigating an increased level of HTTP 5xx errors. This issue has been resolved.

Impact window: Sep. 25, 2025, between 23:10 UTC and 23:52 UTC

incidents.name: Cloudflare Workers Issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating an increased level of errors for customers running Workers scripts.

We are working to analyse and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

components.name: Workers
components.description: Cloudflare Workers provides a serverless execution environment that allows you to create new applications or augment existing ones without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

incidents.name: Dashboard Issues

incident_updates.body:
Today, between 14:07 and 14:11 UTC, some customers may have experienced increased error rates when accessing the dashboard. The issue was identified and promptly resolved.

Important: This did not impact edge traffic or core service functionality, only the dashboard experience was briefly affected.

incidents.name: Network Performance Issues in Istanbul

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Network Performance in Istanbul.

We are working to analyze and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: OWASP rules activating incorrectly for some traffic

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare has noticed an increase of potential OWASP false positives following an upgrade of a service module. This increase was caused by uploaded data wrongly misclassified as form content. Our team is working on deploying a fix.

incidents.name: Unexpected tunnel names displayed in Magic tunnel health check metrics and alerts

incident_updates.body:
Customers may have seen unexpected tunnel names being displayed for their own tunnels in Magic GRE tunnel health check metrics and Magic tunnel alert notification from a small number of Cloudflare colos. This occurred between 2025-09-25 16:30 UTC to 2025-09-26 03:40 UTC. 

This only affected health check metrics and did not impact routing traffic over customer tunnels.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Registrar: Issues with .space domains

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified, and we are working with the affected Registry for a fix.

Cloudflare is currently aware and investigating an issue which potentially affects multiple customers: Registrar customers using .space domains may observe issues or unexpected behavior.
We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

components.name: Registrar
components.description: Cloudflare Registrar securely registers and manages customer domain names

incidents.name: Network performance degradation towards AWS ap-southeast-1 (Singapore) region on September 24

incident_updates.body: Between 06:45 - 07:07 UTC on September 24, traffic from Cloudflare services towards the ap-southeast-1 (Singapore) AWS region may have experienced intermittent increases in network latency and associated errors as a result of this degradation.

incidents.name: Network Performance Issues in New Delhi

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare observed issues with network performance in our New Delhi (DEL) facility from approximately 20:45 to 21:35 UTC today, 2025-09-22.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Dashboard and API may return rate limit errors when modifying IP Lists

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is aware of and currently investigating an issue that may result in rate limit errors when making changes to IP Lists via the Dashboard or API. 

Customers attempting to update IP Lists may experience failed requests or see error messages. 

Further updates will be provided as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Dashboard and Communication Preferences API

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard and related communication preferences API. These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge. Customers using the Dashboard / Cloudflare APIs are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.

incidents.name: Unable to modify bindings in Workers dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Cloudflare is aware of and investigating an issue where users are unable to add/edit/remove bindings from Workers in the Cloudflare dashboard.

components.name: Dashboard
components.description: Dashboard where customers can view and make changes to their configurations at https://dash.cloudflare.com

incidents.name: Cloudflare Pages GitLab Repository Connection Issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with GitLab repository connections for Pages projects. Customers with multiple GitLab accounts may be unable to see their repositories when creating new Pages projects. Existing Pages sites are not affected. We are working to fix this problem. More updates to follow shortly.
